step1.sentence: A good mentor at work is worth their weight in gold because they help you avoid costly mistakes.

step2.story: After months of struggling with her new role, Jina finally found a senior colleague willing to guide her. He patiently taught her the unwritten rules of the office and helped her navigate tricky client situations. She told her friends that a mentor like him was worth his weight in gold.

step3.story: When the startup was on the verge of collapse, the team hired a veteran operations manager named David. Within weeks, he restructured their supply chain and cut costs by thirty percent. He also rebuilt trust with two major clients who had been ready to walk away. The CEO gathered everyone for a meeting and said David was worth his weight in gold. The whole team agreed — without his expertise, they would have shut down before the end of the quarter. From that day on, they never questioned the value of investing in experienced talent.

meaning.realUsageKo: 어떤 사람이나 물건이 매우 유용하고 귀중할 때 사용합니다. 대체할 수 없을 정도로 소중하다는 의미를 강조합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 금이 가장 가치 있는 물질로 여겨지던 시대에서 유래했으며, 무언가의 가치를 금에 비유하는 표현입니다. 고대부터 사용되어 온 매우 오래된 관용구입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 진심 어린 칭찬과 감사의 뉘앙스가 강합니다. 격식 없는 대화에서도 격식 있는 자리에서도 자연스럽게 쓸 수 있는 표현입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: This guidebook is worth its weight in gold for first-time travelers.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 이 가이드북은 처음 여행하는 사람들에게 매우 귀중합니다.
